Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Sorry, a Professor Sapperstein needs to see you in biology. Said it's urgent.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Hey Fred, unlock any secrets of the Universe -- discover we're Alien life forms?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Professor Sapperstein, I'd like you to read something for me.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Very good.  Now are you still sure you want to report the theft of an illegal narcotic?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Good. And how are you feeling right now?

Speaker: sapperstein
Dialogue: You think I'm crazy? Is that what you're saying?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: No, no, not crazy. But this time of year, down here, we're all going a little toasty aren't we? How about you plant a little Cannabis when you get home?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: What do you think?  I know you weren't in the area. What's up?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I got a pilot at ASB who thinks he spotted a popsicle out on the ice.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: And we were doing so well.  Where?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: McClain Valley? What was he doing out there? That's no man's land.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I've got a plane heading to ASB in an hour with some supplies for Winter-over.  Can't get you back until tomorrow.

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: Out back.   What are you doing here?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Checking the freezer for a popsicle.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: It got called in this morning.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Delfy, one of the pilots here.

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: It's his first year down here. You know how that goes. My bet it was just debris, an old tent or something.

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: Here's an idea -- why don't you stay here with me and we'll party, just the two of us. Put those cuffs of yours to work.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: ...Were you the second guy from the front?

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: I'll have them boomerang back and pick up the load -- just have it ready.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: Guys got the science lab all shut down.

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: Good, have them check all the pressure levels on the hydraulics, then clear the exterior storage bins. Make sure we're not leaving anything out there.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Fine. I need a plane and that pilot who saw the popsicle.

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: I'll have him meet you in the hangar.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: In less than three days we begin Winter-over. The sky will go completely black and stay that way for six months.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Your core body temperatures have fallen to approximately 97 degrees. You are shivering uncontrollably -- losing basic motor skills. You're having trouble focusing on even the simplest tasks. In short, you are well on your way to dying, and it has only been two-hundred seconds.  Put your coats on.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Always a pleasure to see you. Unlike most of the beaker-heads down here.  Social visit?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I wish -- We got a job. I need you to take a ride with me.
CONTINUED:  Might be a body out on the ice.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Why's this crap always happen at the end of the season?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: What's your gut say about this body?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: My gut and I don't talk anymore.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I got a card from my Granddaughter inviting me to her fifth birthday party. You know, I've never even met her.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Or mentioned her. A grandchild? Doc, that's great.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: It got me thinking -- I need to be a better Grandfather, than I was a father. It's time I deal with my life. I've been down here a lot longer than I probably should have.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Where the hell they get these thumb-suckers?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Brooklyn. And unless your wrinkled ass has a heart attack on my plane, I think we'll be all right.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: -- I want Keller. He's my pilot.  Keller, get over here!

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Delfy's taking us, Doc. He's the one who saw the body. C'mon, you'll be fine. I'll even hold your hand if you want.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: What were you doing out there?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: I went to evac a camp. Had to fly off route to get around a storm. Got down low to avoid some turbulence, and there it was.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Lucky he got his momma's brain. Kid's smart.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: So why aren't you with him?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: The bonus pay. Trying to buy a house. Give my boy a yard. His own room. Stuff I never had.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Then why are you down here?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Yeah. Got it.      It's a popsicle alright.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: ... It's always different when they freeze. Some curl up. Some stretch out. Some tear their clothes off. They get delirious. What was that guy's name?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Yeah. He's lost in a storm. We can't find him, but we hear him on the radio going on and on about the Serengeti heat and his wife, Janet. Next day, we find him frozen solid, wearing nothing but his bunny boots.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: So do you. Think his name's Weiss. We Wintered-over last year with him. Played cards a couple of times.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Then where's his crampons -- his gear?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: What the hell where you doing all the way out here?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: No -- this is the kind of stuff that scars you for life.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Gonna give myself a Goddamn hernia.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Oh yeah -- I'm really going to miss this place.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Carrie, let's just bag him and put him on a plane to McMurdo.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: It bothers me no one's reported him missing yet.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Because maybe no one thinks he is.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: How'd he get out there?    There were no tracks.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Sounds to me like you and your gut are talking again.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Nobody wants to get out of here more than I do, trust me, but right now -- we're all this guy has.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You know, this means a Federal Investigation, and we're witnesses. We may get stuck here.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: We both want to do the right thing Carrie -- but we also need to get off the ice. Right now we don't have to say a word. When they find something later -- hey, we didn't know. We were leaving, the body was frozen, we didn't have time to examine it. No one gets murdered in Antarctica. Think about it. Dead is dead.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Exactly, this is the first murder in Antarctica, Doc -- and I can't just pretend it didn't happen.  I'm sorry.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Why did I know you were going to say that?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I'm on my way to find out.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I'm sure his family's thinking the same thing.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I hate interrupting educational programming, but --

Speaker: dinkle
Dialogue: Am I in some kind of trouble?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: What are they doing out there?

Speaker: dinkle
Dialogue: Collecting meteorites.  One One has an extremely old surface with low sediment deposition.

Speaker: dinkle
Dialogue: Means it's a good place to look for meteorites.  It's right here.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I don't get it -- Weiss was no where near Delta One One.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Isn't that a little unusual this close to Winter-over?

Speaker: dinkle
Dialogue: Yes, it is. Really unusual, actually.  I guess I should've contacted them, but --

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: -- You've been a little busy. Yeah, I can see that.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Delta One One, this is United States Marshall Carrie Stetko, come back, over.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: This is Marshal Stetko, who's this?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Just gearing my liver up in case I have to stay the next six months.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I'll do everything I can to get you off this ice, promise.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I know you will.  What's the hurry?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I need a plane to Vostok.

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: I don't control the weather -- you want to stay the winter, then don't be ready for your evac.

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: What am I supposed to tell the deep drill ice core team getting picked up in four and a half?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Tell them I took their plane.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: The Russians barely supply Vostok anymore. They have to barter with other bases for supplies. Some of these guys have been rotting here for years.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Stetko, US Marshal. I'm here to talk to an American named Mooney.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: So many people come through Vostok. Is hard to remember.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: Mister Mooney, yes. I remember now. He offers pay us to fly him off Antarctica on our transport. We give him very good price - because plane leaves a week ago!

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Against the law -- Antarctica's the only place in the world you can't have one. Part of the Treaty.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Doesn't that make you feel kind of naked?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: All this crap on -- I prefer naked.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Gettin' worse. Minus eighty-one. Wind at a hundred and ten knots.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Do you have to do that in front of me?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Ever been on a rope-line in a whiteout?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: When   you didn't come back -- we went   looking for you. Found a dead   guy in the other building -- that   Mooney?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Yeah. Someone got to him before I did. Then went after me.  How long was I out?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Whoever it was, could have flown out after the storm broke.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Until I met you, I hadn't seen any dead people. Now I'm at two.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Unless you want your head cracked, I wouldn't move.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Robert Pryce. I'm a United Nations observer for the Oceanic and Antarctic section. If you relax, I've got my ID.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: How do you know about Weiss?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: FBI notified us. Your base commander called it in.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: This is part of a crime scene.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: I realize that, but considering the time constraints we're up against, let's be honest, taping and bagging everything isn't going to be an option.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I'll be sure to let the U.N. know if I find out anything.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: You heading out to Delta One One?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Don't take this personally, but I don't need your help.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: If they've been digging out there, that's a direct violation of the United Nations treaty. We think they were digging. That makes it my business.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: And you don't get killed for them either. This is now a U.N. matter. I am within my rights to commandeer your pilot and plane if I have to.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Fine. But this is my investigation, understand? If you obstruct it in any way, I will have you detained.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Fine.  Mind if I ask you a personal question?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: No, but I have the feeling you're going to anyway.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Why do you smell like suntan lotion?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Murphy, listen to me, it's got to be Rubin who tried to kill me. You have to shut down flights leaving ASB and McMurdo -- search for him.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Sam, I think these guys found something out there at the camp. I'm going to check it out. Until I find Rubin, no one leaves the ice. Not yet.
CONTINUED: Uses the end of the flashlight to chip away a frozen blood sample from the pant leg. Puts it in the baggie.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Someone's left leg took a hit, lost a lot of blood. What do you got?

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Looks like my dad's old lawn mower.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Looks like they were surveying sections at a time.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: At Sections 101 and 102, they spent one day.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Looks like they hit some really big meteors.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Let's go see what they found.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I want to check something out first.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: How long have you been down here, Marshal?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: What brought you to the ice?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Everyone down here is running away from something.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Yeah, and that I should call my mother more often

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Where do you plant your boots?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: They got me working out of Christchurch, New Zealand. Beautiful country. But this -- crazy place to make a living.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I came down to fill in for a Marshal for six weeks before Winter-over. I met someone, decided to stay.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: He give you that ring I saw? Tell you he was going to marry you?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: No -- just gave me a headache.
CONTINUED:  I didn't see a ring on your finger.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Maybe you wrote them down wrong.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Saw a rope in the Cat.
CONTINUED: Twisted, and strewn with large containers scattered at odd angles -- victims of an intense IMPACT. The plane is pitched up at the nose, making their footing precarious.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Cargo plane, but I don't recognize it.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: It's an Antanov-74. Russian made - - late fifties. No one's put these in the air for forty years.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Just answers.  Those are fuel tanks behind you. This plane was outfitted for long range capabilities.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: And by the looks of that safe, must've been transporting something pretty important.
CONTINUED: Part of it has been damaged by the crash and this weakness has been ruthlessly attacked by the previous intruders until they forced an opening. Discarded tools litter the floor.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: They put some serious work into this.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Whoever got hurt, they dragged him out of here. There's blood all over the tunnel.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: This isn't going to work, it's like digging through concrete with a spoon.  We're going to suffocate before we get out here.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: How long do you figure we've got?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Three of us down here -- 12, 15 hours at the most.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: No way. I'm not going out like this. No way.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: What about the Vodka -- we could make some torches, maybe melt the ice?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Fire will burn the O2 quicker.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: All these planes used to have bail- out hatches.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: It'd be on the ceiling in case of an ocean landing.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Or, if the ice is too thick the blast will come right back at us.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: We can be blown up, suffocate or freeze to death. Take your pick.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Delfy, help me with this.     We'll need to get up higher.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Our friend here isn't who he says he is.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: I've been authorized because of what's happened.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Man, the guy just saved our lives...

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: He was saving his own.   Do it.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Have you got an ID for that too?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Listen to me -- Forty eight hours ago, we picked up chatter between someone down here and Tahir Soufian, a black market trader in New York. It was all about setting up a buy for cannisters found in an old Russian transport buried in the ice.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: Damn, I knew that government eavesdropping was true.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: There's been rumors for years that the Russians had a second base -- a secret weapons research facility under the ice that supposedly blew up in the late sixties -- nothing was ever confirmed.

CONTINUED:  The fact is, before the treaty in `72 they were strip mining all over the place down here -- we believe for uranium and other specialized minerals for weapon's use. It was the Cold War. No one knows half the things the Russian's were up to. This plane could be the link between rumor and truth. And if it is true, what's in those cannisters could be a prelude to another terrorist attack.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Why did you lie to me?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Look, the U.N. carries a lot of weight down here. Think about it - - if I had told you I was C.I.A., you would have been on the horn back to Washington in no time. This is a very sensitive matter. News travels fast down here, I don't have to tell you that.  Besides, I didn't know if I could trust you.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Plane could've gone anywhere. There's forty-six countries here all counting down to Winter-over. Rubin could just disappear in the mayhem.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Heading back. How many fly-ins to McMurdo in the last four hours?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I need a list of names.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: You think Rubin might try to leave out of McMurdo?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: He knows I'm on his ass, so he might. Anything's possible. I want to eliminate his options.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: When we get back to the plane, I'll get ya there in forty minutes.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: I'll scan a picture of him and get it to you. Meanwhile, contact every non-American base down here and put them on watch. He's got some plan to get these off the ice.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I know why Weiss was so far from Delta One One.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: You need to get that looked at.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I'll have the Doc take a peek when we're done.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Murphy?   What the hell is he doing HERE

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I'm on 30 if you need me. Rubin's picture is in a file on my desk.

Speaker: dinkle
Dialogue: Make sure I get that back.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: It's packing winds of a hundred thirty knots.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Shit -- we've got to move up the evac.

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: Jesus, I got crew that's still not in.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Where the hell have you been?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Buried under 2 tons of ice. You?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Do me a favor, you find any more bodies, mind not parading them down the main corridor. I've got Newbies afraid to winterover, for Chirstsake. They want out on seats I don't have. And next time you want to take a Goddamn plane anywhere, you ask me.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We don't have enough supplies for all of us to Winter-over if we get stuck down here.  And you wonder why it didn't work out between us.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: It didn't work, Sam, because you couldn't keep your hands off every new woman who stepped foot on the ice down here. I was stupid enough to be one of them. Now if you could cut through your red tape for just one second, you would realize that someone's out there with six cannisters, possibly full of Uranium, and he wants to get it into the hands of some very bad people. And I'm trying to stop it -- so fuck asking you for shit, Sam.
CONTINUED:  Why don't you try helping her for a change?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: You know what Doc, it's alright.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'm worried about you. Is it going to take another attempt on your life to get you to finally slow down?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: You worry too much -- but it's what I like about you.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I striped him down to put him in a bodybag. There's only the puncture from the axe. No way, I would have noticed it. Why?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Then it's gotta be Rubin.  I don't know.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: There's no way they're gonna make it. Not with that storm coming in over the peninsula.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Jesus, Carrie, how long did you let this go?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: When did I go to Vostok?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: No way. Don't tell me that.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: The fingers are dead, Carrie. If I don't do it now, gangrene will set in. You'll lose your hand.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: I stopped by the clinic... Doc told me.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Got Rubin's face all over Antarctica, but nobody's seen him yet.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: I hadn't held a gun in my hand for over two years.  Wasn't supposed to need one down here.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: We were on a stakeout at a Holiday Inn in Miami, waiting for this buy to go down. I was excited, we'd been after this trafficker for a long time. Thought this bust would be my big chance to impress the brass. Anyway, guy's a no show. One hour went by, then two - - nothing.

CONTINUED:  Then Jack starting acting strange. Next thing I knew my face was being rammed into a mirror. My own partner was trying to kill me. Turns out the whole bust was a set up from the start. Jack was dirty, working with the guy we were after.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: It's what the Russians used to transport weapons grade materials in. They match the dimensions inside the safe. We're looking for six of these.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: These beakers where really in over their heads.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: I better get this back to him. And we have to find Rubin.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Think you can you help me with these buttons, first?

Speaker: rubin
Dialogue: -- Did Mooney talk to you? I didn't hear from him -- he was supposed to call me after you talked.

Speaker: rubin
Dialogue: And I'm next, I know it.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: It's okay, you're safe, just put the knife down.

Speaker: rubin
Dialogue: Weiss didn't want to go through with it. Oh God. How did we let this happen?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Rubin -- I need you to focus for me.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: It's okay, he's a doctor, he can help you.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Rubin's here! He's on the run. Level one. White T-shirt. Jeans.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Shit, Rubin doesn't have any gear on.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: How long's he been out there?

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: I sh... sh... shoulda killed you at Vostok.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Help me drag him over here.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: Who's Tahir selling it to -- what's the intended target?

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: What're you doing, you crazy bitch?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Why did you kill those scientists, Keller? Was a four-way split too much for you?

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: You have no idea what's going on here, do you?

Speaker: keller
Dialogue: The plane, they're in the fucking plane.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Have you completely lost your mind?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: The cannisters are on the plane.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: He's with the UN. We have to search that plane now!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We don't have time. We'll just search it in Christchurch when it lands.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: It's a twelve hour flight to Christchurch. Anything can happen in that time. Keller is here, so we know it's still on the ground.
CONTINUED:  Once that plane is in the air, we've as good as lost it. Just give us 10 minutes.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Sam, do what is right here.    Come on.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Do what you have to, but that plane takes off in one hour.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Nothing. That bastard. What the hell are you up to, Keller?

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: I don't get it, why lie to us -- we have him either way. He's stuck here.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: He's got nowhere to go, nowhere to hide.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: He won't try.    He's a goddamn pilot.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Press here.    Hard. Hard or he will die!

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: He's not going to be number four!

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: What are you doing?   Get Keller.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: You're bleeding out. Freezing drops your pulse. We have to slow it down.  You hold on.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Keller got out. He hurt Pryce -- he's bleeding bad. Where's Doc?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Tell him to stay put, and I need your help getting Pryce there. We're at the hangar. I've got to stop Keller, he's got the cannisters.

Speaker: delfy
Dialogue: I know, I know, he'll die!

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: You, four units O-pos in the warmer. Second shelf, fridge.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Keller hit him with an ice axe.

Speaker: rhonda
Dialogue: Sam, it's Rhonda -- we gotta go. Now. MURPHY  I know.    I know.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Can you do this on the plane? It's your call, but I need to know now.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Grab the bodies and get them on the plane.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Leave the bodies -- you don't have time. Dead is dead.  Pick them up in six months. Go.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: What did we miss? Think Keller cut and run without the stuff?

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: After all this, no way. Keller didn't have it on the plane because he's got it hidden somewhere.  Where would he hide something for six months. Somewhere he could be sure no one would ever look.

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: If he had made it out, he wouldn't have been crazy enough to come back for it.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: True -- what the hell was his plan...

Speaker: pryce
Dialogue: We've got six months to figure it out.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Eyes open -- that's always a good sign.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Thank her -- if she hadn't slowed your bleeding.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Just thinking where it all began.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Yeah, it's a damn shame, isn't it.
CONTINUED: Storage racks of frozen science samples line the three walls. Lying on the floor are the bodies of Mooney, Rubin, Weiss and Keller.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Someplace no one would ever think to look.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: And we thought it was nukes the whole time.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Keller said he knew someone in the states who could move the diamonds for us. It was a hell of a lot of money.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: How did you get wrapped up in thing, Doc?

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Weiss got hurt on the plane. They were afraid to move him, so Mooney called me. Keller and I flew out. But they couldn't get the safe open -- Keller found a way.

Speaker: carrie
Dialogue: Then Weiss got cold feet. It got ugly, didn't it -- and Keller killed him at Delta One One. Everything went to hell after that, didn't it, Doc.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Keller thought he could kill his way out of this whole thing.  If those idiots hadn't panicked, none of this would have happened.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I'll cut you in, Carrie. There's at least 5 million in diamonds in there. That can buy both of us a nice life back in the world.
